div.sent: All the animals and birds of the world feel hungry and thirsty every day.
Similarly, as human beings we too have hunger and thirst.
So we eat various kinds of foods and drink water.
As long as we live, we feel hunger and thirst.
We get energy from food and drink.
Human beings had different kinds of hunger.
As human being have physical hunger, so they have mental and spiritual hunger.
To satisfy our physical hunger we eat rice, fish, meat, bread, curry, etc.
We share our joys and sorrows with others.
We also satisfy our spiritual hunger.
For this we go to Church to pray and recite from the Holy Bible.
Everyday we try to follow the wills of God.
People used to come to Jesus for all kinds of foods.
Sometimes, they came with physical hunger, some times for recovery from illness.
They wanted to have peace of mind by listening to Jesus.
Hearing Jesus spiritual words they had spiritual peace.
Jesus was careful to all kinds of their hunger.
So, people were eager to see Jesus.
Once Jesus wanted to go to an isolated place for prayer.
People found him out.
They went to him in groups to listen to his sermon.
In this way one day five thousand people came to Jesus.
Jesus felt pity for them.
He stayed with them.
Like many other days, that day, people brought many ailing persons to him.
He cured them of their illness and advised them.
Thus the evening came by.
The place was far off from the town.
There was no shop around the place from where they could buy food to eat.
But Jesus told his disciples, No, they need not go.
You rather arrange food for them.
The disciples had no food for five thousand people.
They found a boy with some food.
So they said, Here is a boy.
He has five bread and two fish only.
But this is quite inadequate for so many people.
Jesus asked them, Bring whatever you have.
The disciples brought those five bread and those fish to him.
Jesus asked the disciples, Let the people sit on the grass in rows.
The disciples did so.
Jesus then offered those bread and fish to God.
He then thanked and praised God, the Father.
After that he asked his followers to distribute those things to those people.
They gave food to all of them.
What a miracle it was!
Five thousand people ate to their heart content.
But the food was not completely exhausted.
The remaining pieces of bread were collected and stored in one place.
Twelve baskets were filled up with the rest of them.
This was a miracle by Jesus.
It was not possible for a human being.
He did miraculous deeds to reveal God's glory.
So many people cannot be fed with only five pieces of bread and two fish.
It was impossible for an ordinary person, but it was possible for Jesus.
For, he was not only a man but also a God at the same time.
A little boy had only some bread and fish.
The boy had brought it for himself.
He could eat those foods alone on his way home.
But the disciples of Jesus told the boy that Jesus had asked those foods.
On hearing this the boy gave away his foods.
He did not even think about himself.
We Must Sacrifice for Others We have many classmates.
Some of them are rich compared to others.
If they desire they can share their foods with the poor.
Jesus tells us, You must give them food.
Can we share with others what we have?
We can do this, if we try.
But it requires our good intention and an attitude to sacrifice.
Jesus helped people in different ways.
He gave them physical and mental food.
He also gave them their spiritual food too.
Many students come to school without taking food.
We can share our foods with them.
Many are in need of clothes.
We can share our additional clothes with them.
Many orphans have no money to buy books and other necessities.
We can buy books for them with our pocket money.
The blind and the old cannot walk on roads alone.
We can help them walk.
Write down what elsewe can do.
O, Lord Jesus, help and encourage us so that we can do good deeds.
